title: Gothic Astronomy Tower Adventure #68
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Lower Observatory Chamber
rooms.description: A circular stone chamber at the base of an ancient astronomy tower. Gothic arches frame tall windows showing the night sky. Brass instruments and celestial globes rest on wooden tables. Dust motes float in moonbeams. The air smells of old parchment and brass polish. Stone stairs spiral upward into darkness.

items.name: brass celestial globe
items.description: An ornate globe showing constellations and celestial coordinates
items.text: The globe is marked with major constellations: Orion the Hunter, Ursa Major the Great Bear, and Draco the Dragon. A brass plate reads: 'Crafted for the tower in 1687.'

items.name: observation desk
items.description: A heavy oak desk covered with astronomical charts and instruments

items.name: tower chronicle
items.description: A leather-bound book documenting the tower's history
items.text: The Gothic Astronomy Tower was constructed in 1687 by the renowned astronomer Dr Blackwood. He dedicated his life to studying the heavens from this very chamber. His greatest work resides in the Star Chart Library above.

items.name: ornate brass key
items.description: A key engraved with star patterns and celestial symbols

items.name: instrument cabinet
items.description: A tall cabinet storing astronomical tools and devices

items.name: ancient astrolabe
items.description: A brass instrument used for measuring the positions of stars

items.name: wooden storage chest
items.description: A chest bound with iron bands and a brass lock

items.name: astronomer journal
items.description: The personal journal of Dr Blackwood
items.text: Entry 47: My life's work mapping the heavens is nearly complete. The Star Chart Library holds my greatest discoveries. Only those who understand the celestial realm may access the telescope platform above. Three truths guard the way: the constellation of the hunter, where my charts reside, and my own name.

items.name: spiral stone stairway
items.description: Ancient stone steps winding upward through the tower to the library level

rooms.name: Star Chart Library
rooms.description: A magnificent library filled with astronomical charts and ancient texts. Bookshelves line the curved walls, packed with volumes on celestial mechanics. A large table displays star maps under glass. Moonlight streams through a domed skylight. The scent of old leather and ink fills the air. An iron door leads to the telescope platform above.

items.name: star map table
items.description: A table displaying detailed charts of the night sky under protective glass
items.text: The maps show detailed observations of constellations. The most prominent chart depicts Orion, with notes: 'Orion the Hunter - most recognizable constellation in winter skies. Three stars form the belt, sword hangs below.'

items.name: northern bookshelf
items.description: Shelves containing volumes on planetary motion and celestial mechanics

items.name: planetary motion text
items.description: A thick volume discussing the movements of celestial bodies
items.text: Chapter 5: The planets orbit the sun in elliptical paths. Dr Blackwood's observations from this tower contributed greatly to our understanding of celestial mechanics.

items.name: southern bookshelf
items.description: Shelves dedicated to constellation studies and star catalogs
items.text: Section label: 'Constellation Studies - Charts and observations compiled in the Star Chart Library by Dr Blackwood and his predecessors.'

items.name: wooden reading lectern
items.description: A tall lectern holding an open manuscript
items.text: Manuscript page: 'The great astronomer Dr Blackwood spent forty years in this tower, charting the heavens. His star charts, housed in this very library, represent the pinnacle of astronomical knowledge.'

items.name: archive cabinet
items.description: A cabinet with multiple compartments for storing precious documents

items.name: constellation reference guide
items.description: A comprehensive guide to identifying constellations
items.text: Guide excerpt: 'Orion the Hunter is perhaps the most famous constellation, easily identified by the three stars of his belt. Ancient cultures across the world recognized this stellar pattern.'

items.name: iron telescope door
items.description: A heavy iron door leading to the telescope platform at the tower's peak. Three questions are engraved on a brass plate mounted beside it.

password_questions.question: What constellation is known as the Hunter?
password_questions.hint: Check the star maps and constellation guides throughout the library

password_questions.question: Where are the star charts housed?
password_questions.hint: Multiple texts mention where the charts are stored

password_questions.question: Who built this tower?
password_questions.hint: The tower chronicle and various texts name the founder

rooms.name: Telescope Platform
rooms.description: You have reached the pinnacle of the Gothic Astronomy Tower! A magnificent brass telescope points toward the heavens through an open dome. The night sky spreads above in breathtaking glory, stars twinkling like diamonds. The entire countryside is visible far below. A ladder leads down the exterior to freedom. Fresh night air fills your lungs.

items.name: grand brass telescope
items.description: A massive telescope mounted on a rotating platform, pointed at the stars

items.name: observation platform
items.description: The circular platform surrounding the telescope, offering panoramic views

items.name: mounted star charts
items.description: Charts showing the current positions of constellations and planets
items.text: Tonight's sky: Orion rises in the east, the Great Bear circles the north star, and Jupiter shines brightly near the moon.

rooms.win_message: You have reached the telescope platform at the top of the Gothic Astronomy Tower! The mysteries of the heavens spread before you, and the path to freedom lies down the exterior ladder. You have solved the astronomical puzzles and escaped the tower. The stars themselves seem to celebrate your success. You win!
